intro: Fagara goldmanii, commonly known as the golden fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae, which includes a variety of tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Fagara goldmanii produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
